title: King GK
author: King GK
content: Since cryptocurrecy is gaining more popularity can you quite your job to bounty hunting or take bounty as a full time job despite the fall in cryptocurrecy Your advice please........

comments.author: digaran
comments.body: Since most of the projects end up being a scam, I strongly suggest to examine the project you want to promote, remember that earning a few bucks is not worth the loss of potentially millions out of investor's pockets. 99% are scam, don't do it, someday you will have to answer to your maker.

comments.author: Car32
comments.body: Most projects after sometime scam. So never quit your job for bounty hunting programme.

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: I would not advise you to walk away from a guaranteed income, a safe job. Bounty hunting is very unreliable & at worst totally pointless. I think you should probably just find a job you enjoy & work really hard to be the best you can at it. The dream of earning lots of money bounty hunting is likely just that, a dream.

comments.author: nioctib_100
comments.body: Definitely can't replace your job with merely bounty hunting, but by getting involved with the coins themselves and working for them, there certainly can be a path to quitting your job. The ones who run the bounties, for example, are the ones who don't need other jobs. Once you think about it from that perspective and seek to offer your services to these altcoins wherever you can fit in, you'll go up a few levels in what you can earn.

comments.author: Car22
comments.body: Not at all i did,nt want to quit my job for bounty hunting because Alot of project seems to be scammed after a hard work without paying nothing.So never quit your job for the sake of bounty hunting because it is not a guaranteed job. Do your job and when we have free time we do work for bounty hunting.

comments.author: cassandra robert
comments.body: I could advise you in the year 2017/2018 bounty was a hot cake then, but forum mates do not make that mistake because most the bounty are full of scams, You want to leave your job for some little coins ðŸª™ that should be a wrong talk.

comments.author: cute nmp
comments.body: Not a good idea mate.Its not worth to leave a good job for bounty hunting where you earn only a few bucks which may not be enough to pay you bills.Inflation is rising and things are getting expensive day by day,bounty hunting alone can substain you in this new era.

comments.author: Mikhalina Palaha
comments.body: Find main job bro. If you need build passive income in online, it much more way like blogging, affiliate, in youtube, or anything you wants.

comments.author: devil-soul
comments.body: At the moment, even if the market trend seems to be improving, i think it is better to keep a real job to have a stable income

comments.author: Shielding2002
comments.body: Keep your job, a guaranteed source of income. Take bounty hunting as a side hustle to earn more

comments.author: rodskee
comments.body: Quote from: King GK on March 01, 2023, 09:24:37 PMSince cryptocurrecy is gaining more popularity can you quite your job to bounty hunting or take bounty as a full time job despite the fall in cryptocurrecy Your advice please........if you already knew the ins and outs of Cryptocurrency and the risk in bounty thenwhy not? but remember that there is no permanent nor constant income in bounty not like your regular Job that you just need to go to work and you will receive payments , in bounty there are someÂ  or more scam than legit project so be ware of that instance .

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: Quote from: King GK on March 01, 2023, 09:24:37 PMSince cryptocurrecy is gaining more popularity can you quite your job to bounty hunting or take bounty as a full time job despite the fall in cryptocurrecy Your advice please........much like cancer research. if you solve the problem you might get paid, but you are then out of a jobunless you have a line up of multiple bounties that need a solution to allow you to move from one solution to another problem, its not recommendedhowever most bounty's do not come with employment terms such as needing to work 9-5. so you can side hustle bounties as an evening hobby alongside your day job

comments.author: btc78
comments.body: You can gain some profits from bounty but i would not recommend for anyone to do it full-time itâ€™s good for side hustle but since life is very unpredictable itâ€™s still important to have a safety net that is your job in case something happens and bounty is not enough to sustain your life

comments.author: peter0425
comments.body: Quote from: King GK on March 01, 2023, 09:24:37 PMSince cryptocurrecy is gaining more popularity can you quite your job to bounty hunting or take bounty as a full time job despite the fall in cryptocurrecy Your advice please........Dont do that instead have them both mate because that will save your ass having 2 options of profiteering .having Job is a constant flow of money and trust me there is no best way to earn but having a job.having Bounty as well is good but very scammy, there are only few that really pays and almost everyone are scams .just use your spare time in Bounty , focus in Job mate maybe you will have promotion in the future , or better try learning trading instead of bounty so you can clearly become a complete trader.

comments.author: kotajikikox
comments.body: Quote from: King GK on March 01, 2023, 09:24:37 PMSince cryptocurrecy is gaining more popularity can you quite your job to bounty hunting or take bounty as a full time job despite the fall in cryptocurrecy Your advice please........Lol you are already in Bed why need toÂ  go back in the floor? never leave a Job unless you are 100% certain in your next target but since you are asking here meaning you don't really understand bounty that deep so nope don't quit your job at least not for now?maybe in the future when you are ready and have enough knowledge .

comments.author: Natsuu
comments.body: Quote from: btc78 on December 13, 2023, 08:32:16 AMYou can gain some profits from bounty but i would not recommend for anyone to do it full-time itâ€™s good for side hustle but since life is very unpredictable itâ€™s still important to have a safety net that is your job in case something happens and bounty is not enough to sustain your lifeRight?? Diving into full-time crypto bounty hunting sounds tempting, but it's a bit like riding a suicide especially if you already have a full time job. The market's all over the place and relying solely on bounties could be risky. Maybe test the waters part-time, keep a steady income elsewhere and see how it goes before going all in. If you really are certain that you want to do it and you already have enough saving , go try

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: It is an unsure thing to do.But I think that there are people that have already chosen to go full time bounty hunting and it's like hit or miss for them. Some projects may be totally useless but there can be some bounties that they make a lot of money. Just don't leave your job for something uncertain but if someone decides to do that, then I wish you all the good luck.

comments.author: johnsaributua
comments.body: Bounty or bounty hunting rarely exists, even some days and weeks at that time there is nothing at all that can be done, even though there are projects, not all of them are legit and the distribution is erratic depending on the developer.But that's all I can do, and I enjoy, Very grateful for a lot of free time to stay active on bitcointalk, by the way if one day you are active again, you can raise the forum rank first and can apply if there is a signature vacancy like the one I wear, it is the forum option of each user to participate in the siganture campaigne you like. If you are accepted you can get paid regularly every week with bitcoin or altcoin with the qualifications that the developer and manager provide (including the agreed rank and pay).More time, with real and regular pay, of course you can work or do other business in your spare time.
